sen.j: 増子女王（ますこじょおう、正徳 (日本)元年10月19日 (旧暦)（1711年11月28日） - 享保18年10月3日 (旧暦)（1733年11月9日））は江戸幕府第9代将軍・徳川家重の正室。
sen.e: Pricess Masuko (November 28, 1711- November 9,1733) was the legal wife of Ieshige TOKUGAWA, the ninth shogun of the Tokugawa shogunate of the Edo feudal government.
The Pricess Masuko (November 28, 1711- November 9,1733) was the legal wife of Ieshige TOKUGAWA, the ninth Shogun of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。スペースを修正しました。shogun→Shogun,「江戸幕府」を修正しました。
sen.e: The Pricess Masuko (November 28, 1711- November 9,1733) was the legal wife of Ieshige TOKUGAWA, the ninth Shogun of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 伏見宮邦永親王の第4皇女。
sen.e: She was the 4th daughter of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya.
She was the fourth princess of the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya.
sen.cmt: 4th daughter→fourth princess と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: She was the fourth princess of the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya.

sen.j: 幼称は比宮（なみのみや）。
sen.e: Her childhood name was Naminomiya.
Her childhood name was Naminomiya.
Her childhood name was Naminomiya.
Her honorific Buddhist title was 'Shumei-in'.
sen.cmt: 院号はコトバンクによると「 皇太后・准母など皇族の女性で、上皇に準じた待遇を受ける人への尊称。「建礼門院」「東三条院」など。」とのことでした。また、オックスフォード辞書によれば女性に対する尊敬の念を込めた呼び方という事なので、'honorific title'は院号の訳しました。http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/honorific?view=uk
sen.e: Her honorific Buddhist title was Shomyoin
sen.cmt: クォーツ、ハイフンを削除しました。また、「証明院」は”しょうみょういん”と確認しました。
sen.e: Her honorific Buddhist title was Shomyoin

sen.j: 名は培子とも表記する。
sen.e: Sometimes, her name is written 培子 in Kanji characters as well as 増子.
Her name is also written as 培子 or 増子 in Kanji characters.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じてスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: Her name is also written as 培子 or 増子 in Kanji characters.

sen.j: 徳川吉宗の正室・理子女王は叔母に当たる。
sen.e: Her aunt was Princess Sananomiya Masako, the legal wife of Yoshimune TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: Sananomiya Masakoは用語集の検索によります。
sen.e: The Princess Sananomiya Masako, the legal wife of Yoshimune TOKUGAWA was her aunt.
sen.cmt: the を補い、オーダ－を修正しました。
sen.e: The Princess Sananomiya Masako, the legal wife of Yoshimune TOKUGAWA was her aunt.

sen.j: 享保16年（1731年）、家重と婚姻し、江戸城西の丸へ入り、御廉中様（将軍世子の正室）と称された。
sen.e: Having married to Ieshige in 1731, Masuko moved into Nishi-no-Maru castle compound at Edojo-castle where she was addressed 'Gorenchu-sama' because she was the legal wife of the heir to the Shugun.

She married Ieshige in 1731, moved into nishi no maru (a castle compound to the west of the main compound) of Edo-jo Castle, then she was addressed Gorenchu-sama (the legal wife of the heir to the Shugun).
sen.cmt: スペースの修正、Edojo-castle→Edo-jo Castle,「西の丸」の部分を修正しました。全体的にスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: She married Ieshige in 1731, moved into nishi no maru (a castle compound to the west of the main compound) of Edo-jo Castle, then she was addressed Gorenchu-sama (the legal wife of the heir to the Shugun).

sen.j: 享保17年（1732年）には家重と船で隅田川を遊覧した。
sen.e: In 1732, Ieshige and she cruised down the Sumida-gawa River.
In 1732, Ieshige and she cruised down the Sumida-gawa River.
In 1732, Ieshige and she cruised down the Sumida-gawa River.

sen.j: 享保18年（1733年）に懐妊したものの、9月11日に早産（生まれた子はまもなく死去）。
sen.e: Although Masuko became pregnant in 1733, she lost the baby due to premature birth on September 11. (The baby died soon after birth)
Although Masuko became pregnant in 1733, she lost the baby due to premature birth on October 18 (The child died soon after the birth.)
sen.cmt: 享保18年（1733年）9月11日→西暦1733年10月18日として修正しました。カッコ部分、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Although Masuko became pregnant in 1733, she lost the baby due to premature birth on October 18 (The child died soon after the birth.)

sen.j: 増子も産後の肥立ちが悪く、同年10月3日に23歳で死去した。
sen.e: She did not recover from the labour, and died at the age of 23 on 3 October of the same year.
She did not recover from the postpartum, and died at the age of 23 on November 9 of the same year.
sen.cmt: labour→postpartum,享保18年10月3日→西暦1733年11月9日として修正しました。
sen.e: She did not recover from the postpartum, and died at the age of 23 on November 9 of the same year.

sen.j: 寛永寺に葬られ、従二位が追贈された。
sen.e: Masuko was buried at Kakuei-ji Temple, and was confered the posthumous court rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank).
Masuko was buried at Kanei-ji Temple, and was posthumously conferred the the court rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: Kakuei-ji→Kanei-ji,confered→conferred,オーダーの修正、スペースの修正をしました。
sen.e: Masuko was buried at Kanei-ji Temple, and was posthumously conferred the the court rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank).

sen.j: 戒名は証明院智岸真恵大姉。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name was Shomei-in Chigan Shinkei Daishi
Her posthumous Buddhist name was Shomei-in Chigan Shinkei Daishi.
sen.cmt: was→is と修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。「証明院智岸真恵大姉」については確認が取れておりません。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name was 証明院智岸真恵大姉.
sen.cmt: 証明院智岸真恵大姉の読みが不明のため漢字のままとしました。

sen.j: なお、増子は家重の将軍就任前に没したため、御台所とは称されていない。
sen.e: Masuko was never addressed as 'Midaidokoro', honorific Buddhist title (the title used for the wife of a shogun), because she died before Ieshige assumed the position as the Shogun.
Masuko was never addressed as Midaidokoro (the title used for the wife of a shogun), because she died before Ieshige became the shogun.
sen.cmt: クォーツを削除しました。honorific Buddhist title を削除しました。assumed the position as the Shogun→became the shogun と修正しました。
sen.e: Masuko was never addressed as Midaidokoro (the title used for the wife of a shogun), because she died before Ieshige became the shogun.
